entries.name: Age
entries: Treefolk usually take 20 to 30 years to reach adulthood and can live to be several thousand years old.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Treefolk tend towards neutral alignments, following the natural order of things.

entries.name: Size
entries: Treefolk are between 7 to 8 feet tall and weigh as much as a tree. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Nature Adept
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Nature} and {@skill Survival} skills.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Literal Barkskin
entries: When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 16 + your Dexterity modifier (maximum of 2). You can use your barkskin to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your barkskin.
Your barkskin also grants you resistance to bludgeoning and piercing damage; but also vulnerability to fire damage.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries: While you remain motionless, you are indistinguishable from a normal tree.

entries.name: Plant
entries: Your creature type is plant, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Tree Magic
entries: You know the {@spell druidcraft} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell entangle} spell once with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell spike growth} spell once per day with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.
At first glance it would be hard to distinguish a Treefolk from a regular tree; believed to be descended from particularly ancient treants these creatures bear several similarities.

Typically peaceful, Treefolk thrive amongst nature as natural gardeners, sharing a kinship with the natural world and bolstered by their innate magical nature. While slow, Treefolk can be a force to be reckoned with, their natural barkskin as tough as chain mail and possessed of a surprising amount of strength.
